content.2: For unto us was the gospel preached, as well as unto them: but the word preached did not profit them, not being mixed with faith in them that heard
content.3: For we which have believed do enter into rest, as he said, As I have sworn in my wrath, if they shall enter into my rest: although the works were finished from the foundation of the world.
content.4: For he spake in a certain place of the seventh
content.6: Seeing therefore it remaineth that some must enter therein, and they to whom it was first preached entered not in because of unbelief:
content.7: Again, he limiteth a certain day, saying in David, To day, after so long a time; as it is said, To day if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts.
content.8: For if Jesus had given them rest, then would he not afterward have spoken of another day.
content.9: There remaineth therefore a rest to the people of God.
content.10: For he that is entered into his rest, he also hath ceased from his own works, as God
content.11: Let us labour therefore to enter into that rest, lest any man fall after the same example of unbelief.

content.14: Seeing then that we have a great high priest, that is passed into the heavens, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold fast
content.15: For we have not an high priest which cannot be touched with the feeling of our infirmities; but was in all points tempted like as
content.16: Let us therefore come boldly unto the throne of grace, that we may obtain mercy, and find grace to help in time of need.
